summary: This is an email chain from May 6, 2020, between Assistant United States Attorneys in the Southern District of New York. The emails discuss forming an IT working group related to document review platforms (like Relativity) and suggest checking in with the 'Epstein team' regarding review-related issues they have encountered.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: The sender of the initial email, identifying themselves as the PC representative for an IT working group on document review platforms.

events.title: IT Working Group Formation
events.description: An Assistant United States Attorney emails colleagues about forming a working group to address IT issues related to document review platforms like Relativity.

locations: One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The email is dated May 6, 2020, indicating ongoing case-related activity years after Epstein's death.
The correspondence is between Assistant United States Attorneys in the Southern District of New York.
The email explicitly references an 'Epstein team' that has had 'various review-related issues' with document review platforms.
The subject involves forming an IT working group focused on platforms like Relativity, used for document review in legal cases.
The document shows internal DOJ coordination on technical challenges related to the Epstein case review process.
